page.title: 01Land North Est Hempnall
page.content: The block contains mainly farmland, small woods, scattered farm houses and farm building. The land is used for arable farming, the main crops being almost entirely cereal and sugar beet. Although flat and relatively low lying the retention of hedgerows between fields results in an interesting rural outlook. Being only about 9 miles south of Norwich the area is, apart from the farming activities, mainly a dormitory area for people employed in Norwich and the retird. The farming activities being highly mechanised very few people are employed and most residents in the village of Hempnall are forced to work away from the area. Saxlingham Green consists of a farm or two, a few cottages and The Hall, now Nursing Home.
